Seventy-two years. Yeah, it's a long time.

back in 2010 and 2016,
but this one's gonna be a lot more like the great blizzard of 1947.

Well, you know, I have a passion for weather. Yeah.

Oh, gosh, she is all over the place.

why half the hospitals in this city have shut down.
Can y'all take those, go to oncology.

and I pared down to a skeleton crew.

You're a doctor.

Both.

Go on, then. Ask.

Legless?

Max is very respectful of my role as his doctor, thank you.
I apologize.
I would never question your effectiveness as a doctor.
I just wondered if the...
The thing you guys have made it difficult.
Excuse me, Max and I don't have a thing.
The vibe?
What are you talking about? There is no vibe.

Maybe you're psychic.

Why do you need yours?
You know that they won't pick up now and then when you leave,
I won't have a phone in case they call back.
I will leave mine with you.

And it's snowing cats, dogs, and reindeer out there.
It's good you got in from Vermont when you did.
See?
No, sorry, I meant, because we need to start
Chrissy on an immune checkpoint inhibitor tonight.

That sounds like something I should probably tell the kids.
Tell them.
You sound exactly like me and my wife.
Always arguing about silly things.
I'm going back to our Airbnb, so I can get a few hours sleep.
I will bring you your phone in the morning.
Shouldn't having cancer mean that I get to win every argument?
Hey, there's my deputy. Wait, where's your hat?
Oh, I forgot it because, you know,
I was forced out of the warmth quite suddenly.
Yeah, but not wearing a hat in this weather is a little insane.
Yeah, I'm your doctor, Max. Not the other way around.
Hey, are you okay?
Um...
I'm fine, I just...
I just had to walk four blocks in a blizzard because

35th and 1st, but there's no casualties,
just people thought they could drive in this.
Wait, what is it?
That's right in front of Station 27.
I was just coming to find you.
When's the last time you got an ambulance in here?
Forty-seven minutes ago.
This is Max Goodwin at New Amsterdam.
I need to talk to EMS Division Chief Molinari.
I'm on.

Snowplows can't get through to Murray Hill or Kips Bay.
Are calls coming in?
Many, but without snowplows, our vehicles can't get to them.

and keep them coming. Copy that.
If people can't get to this hospital,
then we need to bring this hospital to them.
I know being stuck at the hospital during a blizzard sucks,
but do you know what's worse?
Needing 911 in a blizzard and being told that no one is coming.
So I have here a list of 911 calls within a half-mile of New Amsterdam.
Ambulances can't get to them, but we can.
And, yes, conditions are bad out there, but we have got parkas,
and we have got emergency packs, and we have got chutzpah.

and we're gonna give you a GPS Locator, so we can track you
from right here in the hospital.
And to be clear, nobody has to go.
But we're their only shot, so...
Any volunteers?

I'll go with you.
Casey and Flores, yes.

can't move, may be unconscious.

I'll go with you.

treat them, and get back here so we can send you

And, guys, let's be careful out there.
